radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Computed Tomographic (CT) scan of the thorax
radiographic_examinations.findings: No evidence of pulmonary embolism but revealed inflammatory changes of the aortic arch, small pericardial effusion, and a pulmonary artery diameter of 3.2 cm.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT scan of the chest, abdomen, and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: Soft-tissue linear density of moderate size within the mediastinum consistent with inflammation or hemorrhage; the ascending aorta was dilated, with a maximal diameter of 4.5 cm; small pericardial effusion; small bilateral pleural effusions; lungs were clear.
Focal linear flap in the proximal ascending aorta, slight dilation of the aorta to about 4.4 cm, and an eccentric jet of mild-to-moderate aortic insufficiency.
